Articles.Content:
Hi

Daft question, I've downloaded a mod but can't work out how to install it - please can you help. I'm running KSP ON an I Mac 

thanks

Hi Scubapink, I believe installing addons on a Mac is the same as with Windows and Linux, if you unzip the addon to the Kerbal Space Program/GameData folder it should find it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If you're running the Steam version of KSP on OSX, the location of the directory can get a little wonky compared to what you might be used to for your applications. The KSP folder itself, in a typical install, will be located in:

~/Library/Application Support/Steam/SteamApps/common/Kerbal Space Program

and inside the "Kerbal Space Program" folder there will be a folder called GameData. For most mods, all you do is move the folder containing all of the mod files to GameData. Even if a mod has a more complicated procedure to follow, generally the first step will be locating the "Kerbal Space Program" folder anyway.
Brill, thanks - will give it a try ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

It's also worth noting that the contents/organisation of mods' zip files does differ from one to another. If you tell us the mod you've downloaded, or even better show us its folder-structure, we can give you specific instructions of what has to go into the installs' GameData.

Im running KSP on my 2013 MacBook Pro (stock runs pretty good actually, relatively speaking), I just want some helpful mods to make the game easier, but won't slow down the game. For MechJeb and Kerbal Engineer, can I just plop the files in the GameData folder and I'm good to go?

What about the "Restock" mod? Let me know!
